item.title: Radar processing
item.description:
I’ve been doing some work to bring the St. Olaf deep radar processor (StODeep) up into this decade. I’ve had some time twiddling my thumbs while running ice-flow models, and I’ve been doing the work of migrating StODeep as I wait for the model runs. I’m not a fan of Matlab, so I’ve migrated things to Python.

A bit of background

The St. Olaf Deep radar processor has a long history that I don’t fully know. I’m not at St. Olaf, and the processor can also do shallow radar, and is better described as an impulse radar processor. I’ve decided to call it ImpDAR for that reason.

Full Documentation

I’m still working on examples, but the documentation is on this site.

item.title: Python Brownbag
item.description:
I’m giving a short seminar on python for matlab users this Friday. I plan to give a short presentation on why grad students in Earth and Space Sciences might want to switch from Matlab, followed by prepared demos where people can follow along.

I’ll also introduce git, since I think it is probably more important for productivity than the matlab/python choice. Hopefully I’ll have a few open-source converts by the end of the week!

Everything I’m presenting is on github. There are two sets of slides, one on Python vs. Matlab and one giving a whirlwind intro to git and the package managers.
